content.description: Wax On, Wax Off ascends nice, smooth, white rock with a thin, bulging arete climb on it. It is short but engaging fun.
content.location: This is farther up and around the rock than all of the other routes. It is the last route on the left side of the rock. The crux may be finding this route, it can be a bit of a bushwhack, but it is well worth the effort.

content.description: This climbs easy steep terrain to the first bolt. Then it eases off before the intimidating looking roof. Hidden holds will get you through the roof and on to the top.
content.protection: 4 bolts? and a two bolt anchor. Chains were missing at last report (7-15-19).
content.location: It is uphill and around a corner from the other routes. This is left of a manky, moss-filled corner.

content.description:
Climb the first five bolts of "

Social Distance

" to the hands free rest. Move right around an arete to a lower angle water groove with a straight in crack/seam. Climb this to the second hands free rest. Finish with the last three bolts of "

Social Distance

".
content.protection:
8-9 bolts on "

Social Distance

", finger size and smaller gear for the crack, and a two bolt chain anchor. A 70 meter rope is needed to get off.
content.location:
Use the same start as "

Social Distance

" around the right side of the formation. Look for the vertical water groove of

Social Distance

.

content.description: Climb steep slab for 5 bolts to a hands free rest. Follow bolts up a vertical water groove to another hands free rest. Three more bolts take you up more slab to the top.
content.protection: 15 bolts to a two bolt chain anchor.... A 70 meter rope is needed to get off!
content.location: When arriving at the Wax Museum, move around the toe of the buttress to the right, and look for a bolted route heading up a steep slab. The vertical water groove above is pretty easy to spot. There is a nice shoe up spot at the base of the route. It is best to belay down and right about 10-15 feet.

content.description:
Climb the first five bolts of "

Social Distance

to the hands free rest. Move about 6-8 feet left, and climb the straight in finger to hand sized crack in a corner. After about 50 feet, move up and right to the last three bolts of "

Social Distance

".
content.protection:
Finger to hand-sized gear in the crack, 8-9 of the bolts on "

Social Distance

", and a two bolt chain anchor. A 70 meter rope is needed to get off!
content.location:
Use the same start as for "

Social Distance

" around the right side of the buttress.

content.description: Start on the right side of the corner. Clip a couple of bolts, and step left to surmount the massive block above (crux?). From the top of the block, step across the chasm to the upper section. Clip three more bolts through the mini-roof to the top.
content.protection: 6-7 bolts and a two bolt chain anchor.
content.location: Walk uphill past the lower slab routes. You will come to a wide belay platform with three route above it. Silver Lining starts off the right side of this platform in a corner.

content.description:
Stem up a water groove/overlap feature. Follow this feature up and left to shared anchors of "

Wax On, Wax Off

".
content.protection: 4 bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It starts off of the farthest left (uphill) belay station just to the right of

Wax On, Wax Off

.

content.description: Start with thin edges and slopers to gain a blunt arete. After the third bolt, the angle eases for a bit then steepens in a fun corner. The cruxy corner leads to pretty straightforward climbing to the top.
content.location: It is the first route you come to at the top of the approach trail. This climbs from the toe of the rock up a white rib/fin feature.

content.description: Start under the water streak, and move up and right of the streak. Staying right of the mossy water streak, work your way through the first crux. The route eases up a little until the last, little, steep crux.
content.protection: 7 bolts and a two bolt chain anchor.
content.location: It is the fifth route uphill from the bottom (right) side of the Big Slab. Start under a black water streak (which may be wet early season).

content.description: Moose Wallow is a fun slab climb through a couple of overlaps. The crux is getting through the first overlap.
content.protection:
5 bolts and a two bolt anchor. The chains are missing on this anchor, but you can step right to the

Carnuba

anchors to get off.
content.location: It starts off of its own belay platform just down and right of the upper (farthest left) platform.

content.description: Climb through edges, sidepulls, and mini-overlaps on the steeper first half. Get your slab technique going for the second half....
content.protection: 7 (now 8?) bolts and a two bolt chain anchor.
content.location:
Start just left and uphill from "

First Black One

". It is the third route from the right.

content.description: Another fun slab climb on the main section of the wall, M.O.M. (Museum of Moss) climbs the left, uphill side of the main wall. This is the sixth bolted route uphill on the main, big slab. There is a bit of a crux on the steeper lower section and another one on the smoother, upper slabby section. There is a nice variety of climbing on this one.
content.protection: 7 bolts and a two bolt chain anchor.
content.location:
It is the farthest uphill route on the big, main slab and the sixth route up from the bottom. Start just left of

Pandemic Development

.

content.description: Floor Wax is very similar to the two routes right of this one, just a little bit harder. The crux is the thin, smooth looking slab after the halfway point.
content.protection: 7 bolts and a two bolt chain anchor.
content.location: It is the fourth route from the right and starts on a nice belay platform.

content.description: A tricky start on edges and sidepulls leads to various options through mini-overlaps and bulges. The route wanders a bit when the steepness eases off. The crux may be deciding which holds to use and which way to wander at the top.
content.location: It is the second route from the right and starts off the second staging platform.

content.description: Carnuba is slabby fun through a couple of overlaps. The crux is getting over the last overlap.
content.protection: 6 bolts and a two bolt chain anchor.
content.location: Walk uphill past the lower slab routes until you reach a nice wide belay platform with three routes above it. Carnuba starts off of the left side of this belay platform.
